definitions.definition: (sometimes offensive) a person who has severely impaired physical abilities because of deformation, injury, or amputation of parts of the body.
definitions.example: He returned from war a cripple.

definitions.definition: A shortened wooden stud or brace used to construct the portion of a wall above a door or above and below a window.
(among lumbermen) A rocky shallow in a stream.
To make someone a cripple; to cause someone to become physically impaired
definitions.example: The car bomb crippled five passers-by.
My ambitions were crippled by a lack of money.

definitions.definition: To release a product (especially a computer program) with reduced functionality, in some cases, making the item essentially worthless.
definitions.example: The word processor was released in a crippled demonstration version that did not allow you to save.

definitions.definition: To nerf something which is overpowered
